translations.name: The Orthodox Study Bible
translations.description: The Orthodox Study Bible (OSB) is an English-language translation and of the Christian Bible, published by Thomas Nelson in 2008 and intended for Orthodox Christian audiences. In addition to the Eastern Orthodox biblical canon, it offers commentary and other material to better inform an Eastern Orthodox interpretation of the Bible. The Old Testament was prepared under the auspices of the academic community at St. Athanasius Academy of Orthodox Theology, using clergy and lay scholars. The overview committee included fourteen archbishops, metropolitans, and bishops from various Orthodox jurisdictions, as well as eight priests and seven lay scholars.
